tsinterp.name: tsinterp
tsinterp.description:
A class that fills the missing documents in the timeseries by interpolation. Two public methods:
- a constructor tsinterp() that learns all the documents of a timeseries
- a method smooth() that takes as parameter a date (string with ISO format) and returns associated document with interpolated values Completely independent from tsproc module, so should be used as a normal Node.js module. Based on the Smooth.js.

params.name: timeseries
params.description: A timeseries to learn. An array of JSONs

params.name: description
params.description: A description of fields and timestamps (with their format) of the each timeseries

params.name: callback
params.description: An error callback

tsproc.name: tsproc
tsproc.description:
TimeSeries Processor (tsproc) is a module that takes in one or multiple timeseries whis their configuration (cf constructor) and offers different public methods to process and explore the timeseries.
The main public methods are: - cut(): cutting the range of documents - interpolate(): interpolation of missing documents - intersect(): leaving the intersected documents between the timeseries - merge(): merging multiple timeseries into one - renameField(): renaming a field in all documents - checkSimilarity(): similarity check between timeseries - toISO(): passing the timestamp to the ISO format - undersample(): timeseries size reduction - quantize(): values and timestamps quantification - process(): a combination of all the previous methods All of the sited methods are changing the state of the timeseries (which is irreversible) and all of them are using a callback function in order to pass erros and return modified timeseries.

params.name: timeseries
params.description: An array of timeseries. Each one should be sorted

params.name: config
params.description: A description of each timeseries (cf example)

params.name: err_callback
params.description: Error callback

tsreductions.name: tsreductions
tsreductions.description: Class contaning the size reduction functions used by the tsproc module. These functions have access to the internal methods of tsproc, so from within the tsproc, they should be called using the call(this, ..) method.

classitems.name: INTERP_METHODS
classitems.description: Description of interpolation methods. Methods comparation could be found here.

A main public method that takes in the date
and determines, based on the previously learnt documents,
the interpolated document with given date.
classitems.name: smooth

params.name: date
params.description: A date from which to interpolate (ISO string)

params.name: callback
params.description: A callback function

classitems.description:
A private method that generates a json document from
given values.
classitems.name: createDoc

params.name: time
params.description: An ISO string representing the date

params.name: values
params.description: An array of values of document fields

classitems.description:
A private method that exracts an array of dates (moment.js dates) from all the documents
in a timeseries.
classitems.name: extractDates

classitems.description:
A private method that exracts an array of values of all
the documents in a timeseries.
classitems.name: extractValues

classitems.description:
A private method that learns the values
of each document of the timeseries.
classitems.name: learn

params.name: callback
params.description: An error callback

classitems.name: ISO_FORMAT
classitems.description:
A constant that holds
the format of ISO date.

classitems.name: UNIX_FORMAT
classitems.description:
A constant that describes
when the timestamp format is a unix
timestamp.

classitems.name: TIMESTAMP_FIELD
classitems.description:
A constant that holds the name 
of the timestamp field that would be generated 
after the merge (cf merge() and process() functions).

classitems.name: InterpEnum
classitems.description: A description of interpolation methods offered by the tsinterp class.

classitems.name: ReduceEnum
classitems.description: A description of timeseries size reduction methods offered by the tsreductions class.

classitems.name: QuantTSEnum
classitems.description:
A description of types
of the timestamp quantification.

classitems.name: ReduceFunc
classitems.description:
An array of timeseries size
reduction functions.

A main public method that processes a set of timeseries. It returns (via callback) a single timeseries with timestamp 'time' with ISO format. The processing takes the next steps: - if the borders (min and max dates) are specified in the config file, the timeseries would be cut - all the dates would be transformed to the ISO string - if there are multiple timeseries, and they are not homogeneous, all the timeseries would be interpolated or intersected (cf intersect() function) - if the are multiple timeseries (and after the previous step they are all homogeneous), they would be merged into one timeseries document by document - the output timeseries's timestamp field would be called 'time' and it would be an ISO string - if the skip value is defined in the JSON config, the timeseries would be undersampled to decrease it's size - finally, if the quantification is demanded (in the JSON config), the values of the timeseries (timestamps and normal) would be quantified
classitems.name: process

params.name: callback
params.description: A callback function

classitems.description: Public method that returns (directly or via callback) a single timeseries if there is only one (if it is merged for example), or an array of timeseries if trere are many.

return.description: One or an array of timeseries

classitems.description: Public method that returns (directly or via callback) a timeseries config JSON. Note: for now, it returns only the timeseries config of the tsproc (not the options like transform type, data borders, correlaiton, etc).

params.name: callback

If there is no timeseries specified, returns the size of the first one.

params.name: doc_index
params.description: The index of the document in the timeseries

classitems.description: Public method that returns an empty document. It is generated from a normal document (specified by ts_index and doc_index) by emptying all the fields except the timestamp. Used by tsreductions class.

params.name: ts_index
params.description: The index of timeseries

params.name: doc_index
params.description: The index of the document in the timeseries

classitems.description: Public method that takes a timestamp and returns (via callback) a document from the timeseries that corresponds to it.
classitems.name: getDocByTimestamp

params.description: The index of timeseries

params.name: timestamp
params.description: A string with date in ISO format

params.name: callback
params.description: A callback function

classitems.description:
Public method that returns an array of non-timestamp
 fields present in the specified timeseries 
(ie in each of it's documents).
classitems.name: getFields

params.name: ts_index
params.description: The index of timeseries

classitems.description:
Public method that returns an average number of timestamps per day.
The timeseries should be merged.
classitems.name: getAvgPerDay

return.description: An average number of timestamps per day

classitems.description:
Public method that returns the date borders, which corresponds
to the earliest timestamp from all the timseries and the oldest timestamp 
from all the timeseries.
classitems.name: getBorders

return.description: An array with date (string with ISO format) borders

classitems.description:
Public method that verifies wheather the timeseries is homogeneous.

If there is only one timeseries, it is considered homogeneous.
If there are many, they are considered homogeneous if every timeseries
has the same timestamps at same positions.
classitems.name: isHomogeneous

return.description: Wheather a set of timeseries is homogeneous

classitems.description:
Public method that checks wheather the format of the timestamps in each
timeseries is correct.
classitems.name: isValid

return.description: Wheather the date format is correct

classitems.description: Public method that renames a field in the specified timeseries.
classitems.name: renameField

params.name: ts_index
params.description: The index of a timeseries

params.name: field_name
params.description: A field to rename

params.name: new_name
params.description: A new field name

params.name: callback
params.description: A callback function

classitems.description:
Public method that checks wheather the timestamps have ISO format.
The method checks only the format written in config JSON, it does not verify the timestamps
of all the documents.
classitems.name: isISO

params.name: ts_index
params.description: The index of timeseries

return.description: Wheather the timestamps have the ISO format

classitems.description:
Public method that checks wheather the timestamps have UNIX format.
The method checks only the format written in config JSON, it does not verify the timestamps
of all the documents.
classitems.name: isUNIX

params.name: ts_index
params.description: The index of timeseries

return.description: Wheather the timestamps are unix timestamps

classitems.description: Public method that attribute field of the timeseries at ts_index is nominal (not numeric) or not.
classitems.name: isFieldNominal

params.name: ts_index
params.description: Index of a timeseries to check

params.name: field
params.description: A field to check

return.description: True if the field is nominal, false if not

classitems.description:
Public method that checks wheather one of the timeseries
has a nominal field.
classitems.name: isNominal

return.description: Wheather one of the timeseries has a nominal field

classitems.description:
Public method that passes all the timestamps 
to the ISO format (YYYY-MM-DDTHH:mm:ss.SSSSZ).
The name of the timestamps is not changed.
classitems.name: toISO

params.name: callback
params.description: A callback function

classitems.description: Public method that leaves in the timeseries only the documents between two dates specified in the date_borders array
classitems.name: cut

params.name: date_borders
params.description:
An array of two dates 
(ISO strings)

params.name: callback
params.description: A callback function

classitems.description: Public method that merges two or more timeseries into one timeseries. The timeseries should be homogeneous. The result timeseries would have only one timestamp field (it's name is specified by TIMESTAMP_FIELD proprety).
classitems.name: merge

params.name: callback
params.description: A callback function

classitems.description: Public method that reduces the number of documents in the timeseries by different methods. Applied only if the timeseries are homogeneous. And only if the field values are numeric (non-nominal). Uses a tsreductions module. The reduction mehtods are: - skip: choose one document (first) from skipsize documents - sum: sum the values of skipsize documents into one - avg: average the values of skipsize documents into one - max: choose one document from skipsize documents with the maximum value of target_field - min: choose one document from skipsize documents with the minimum value of target_field
classitems.name: undersample

params.name: type
params.description: An index of ReduceEnum with reduction methods

params.name: skipsize
params.description: A number of documents to be reduced into one

params.name: target_field
params.description: A targeted field to calculate the max or min reduction

params.name: callback
params.description: A callback function

classitems.description: Public mehtod that could be applied for two or more timeseries to interpolate the missing datapoints (documents) in relation to each other. Interpolation methods are: linear, cubic, lanczos, and neares neighbor. Methods comparaison could be found here. Timestamps should be the ISO strings and field values should be numeric (non-nominal). Uses a tsinterp module.
classitems.name: interpolate

params.name: type
params.description: An index of InterpEnum with interpolation methods

params.name: callback
params.description: A callback function

classitems.description:
Public mehtod that could be applied for two or more timeseries
to simplify them and leave only the documents that have the same
timestamps in different timeseries (cf example).

Timestamps should be the ISO strings.
classitems.name: intersect

params.name: callback
params.description: A callback function

classitems.description: Public method that checks the local similarity between the fields of a timeseries. Does this by caclulating the local correlation. Timeseries should be merged (ie the function works only with a single timeseries) and have two non-timestamp fields. The timeseries values should be non-nominal. The similarity is indicated by adding a new field 'correlation' to each document. If value of this field is not 'false', it means that a document is a part of a set of documents that are strongly correlated. The correlation is considered strong if correalation coef is > 0.6. More info about correlation can be found here.
classitems.name: checkSimilarity

params.name: callback
params.description: A callback function

classitems.description:
Public method that is aplying the 
quantification to all the values 
of the timeseries (timestamps and normal).

Timeseries should be merged (ie the function works only with a single timeseries),
timestamps should have an ISO format.
The non-numeric (nominal) fields are ignored.
classitems.name: quantize

params.name: callback
params.description: A callback function

classitems.description: Private method that merges the configuration of multiple timeseries into one. The final timestamp name is defined by the TIMESTAMP_FIELD proprety.
classitems.name: mergeConfigs

classitems.description:
Private method that returns the minimal (the earliest)
date of all the timeseries.
classitems.name: getMinDate

classitems.description:
Private method that returns the maximal (the oldest)
date of all the timeseries.
classitems.name: getMaxDate

classitems.description:
Private method that cuts in a specified timeseries all the documents
that are bellow the specified index.
Index is included in a cut.

params.name: index

classitems.description:
Private method that cuts in a specified timeseries all the documents
that are above the specified index.
Index is included in a cut.

params.name: ts_index
params.description: An index of a timeseries to cut

params.name: index

classitems.description: Private method that cuts in all the timeseries the documents that are earlier than max_date.
classitems.name: cutAboveMax

params.name: max_date
params.description: A moment.js date

classitems.description: Private method that cuts in all the timeseries the documents that are older than min_date.
classitems.name: cutBellowMin

params.name: min_date
params.description: A moment.js date

classitems.description:
Private method that returns an array
of all the possible dates of all the timeseries (without duplication).

The timestamps of all the timeseries shoud be the ISO strings.
Final array of dates is sorted chronologically.
classitems.name: getAllDates

return.description: An array of all possible dates (ISO strings) in all the timeseries

classitems.description:
Private method that returns an array
of dates that are part of all the timeseries.

The timestamps of all the timeseries shoud be the ISO strings.
classitems.name: getSameDates

return.description: An array of dates (ISO strings) that are part of all timeseries

classitems.description:
Private method that returns an array
of all the dates present in a specified timeseries.
classitems.name: getTSDates

params.name: ts_index
params.description: An index of a timeseries to extract the dates

return.description: An array of dates from a specific timeseries

classitems.description:
A private method that exracts an array of values of all
the documents in a timeseries.

The function works only with merged timeseries.
classitems.name: extractValues

params.name: borders
params.description: An array of indexes between which the values should be extracted

classitems.description: A private method that calculates the correlation coefficient between two arrays of digits. Using this correlation formula.
classitems.name: getCorrelationCoef

params.name: array1
params.description: First array of digits to count the correlation

params.name: array2
params.description: Second arrya of digits to count the correlation

classitems.description:
A private method that adds to the set of documents (specified by the borders) a field 'correlation' with value corr_value (cf example). If no borders are specified, the field would be added to all of the documents of the timeseries.
If no correlation value is specified the 'false' would be attributed. The method works only with merged timeseries and only if there are at least 2 non-timestamp fields.
classitems.name: markCorrelation

params.name: borders
params.description: An array of indexes between which the correlation should be marked

params.name: corr_value
params.description: The correlation value to add

classitems.description:
Private method that returns
the size of a quantum by wich
the field should be quantized.
The quantum value is read from
the config JSON.
classitems.name: getQuantum

params.name: ts_index
params.description: Index of the timeseries where the field is

params.name: field_index
params.description: Index of the field to get the quantum

classitems.description:
Private method that returns the size of a quantum by wich the timestamp field should be quantized. The quantum value is read from the config JSON.
For the timestamp fields, the possible values are: - 'none' - 'day' - 'month' - 'year'
classitems.name: getTSQuantum

params.name: ts_index
params.description: Index of the timeseries where the timestamp field is

params.name: field_index
params.description: Index of the timestamp field to get the quantum

return.description: A quantum of a timestamp field

classitems.description:
Reduction of the timeseries size by choosing one document 
(allways the first one) from the set of documents.
classitems.name: reduceSkip

params.name: skipsize
params.description: A number of documents to choose from

classitems.description:
Reduction of the timeseries size 
by summing the values of all the
fields in a set of documents.
classitems.name: reduceSum

params.name: skipsize
params.description:
A number of documents to
be reduced into one by summing

classitems.description:
Reduction of the timeseries size 
by averaging the values of all the
fields in a set of documents.
classitems.name: reduceAvg

params.name: skipsize
params.description:
A number of documents to
be reduced into one by averaging

classitems.description: Reduction of the timeseries size by finding the document with the max value of target_field between a set of documents.
classitems.name: reduceMax

params.name: skipsize
params.description: A number of documents to be reduced into one by finding the max

params.name: target_field
params.description:
A field by which all the documents are compared
to calculate the max

classitems.description: Reduction of the timeseries size by finding the document with the min value of target_field between a set of documents.
classitems.name: reduceMin

params.name: skipsize
params.description: A number of documents to be reduced into one by finding the min

params.name: target_field
params.description:
A field by which all the documents are compared
to calculate the min
